meta.title: Home - Gilroy Unified School District

Board of Education Goals and Objectives

Dr. TJ Owens Gilroy Early College Academy
Board of Education Goals and Objectives

div.class: fsElement fsResourceElement fsSlideshow home-slideshow fsSlideshowHorizontal fsStatePlaying

figcaption.p: Our programs provide meaningful opportunities to build community
Our resources provide quality experiences to students, inside and outside the classroom
Our schools nurture the unique journey of all students, from kindergarten through graduation
Our schools provide 21st-century environments for students to grow and thrive
Our staff strives to maintain the highest-quality educational standards

p.span: Need to rent a GUSD facility? Click here.

div.p: Check here for enrollment and residency verification information.

p.span: Click here for contact information for all of our school sites.
Click below to download the current GUSD Board of Education meeting agenda

img.alt: County of Santa Clara Health Officer Issues New Order to Gather Information Regarding Inventories of Personal Protective Equipment and Ventilators

div.a: County of Santa Clara Health Officer Issues New Order to Gather Information Regarding Inventories of Personal Protective Equipment and Ventilators (opens in new window/tab)

article.a: Read Full Story about County of Santa Clara Health Officer Issues New Order to Gather Information Regarding Inventories of Personal Protective Equipment and Ventilators (opens in new window/tab)

li.a: Report a Problem with this website

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.p: Distance learning for GUSD students began Monday, April 13, 2020. Information about distance learning can be found here.

Free breakfast and lunch for all children (ages 0-18) is available at a number of our school sites through the end of the school year. Please note that there is one distribution time for food and children DO NOT need to be present to receive meals.

The District Office has a specially designated email address and phone number for the public to submit questions or concerns regarding steps the District is taking in response to COVID-19. Email questions@gilroyunified.org or call 669-205-5590.
